page.title: 02GENERAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: Most of the area is part of the plain beside the Severn but a promontory, Knole Park with sides covered by scrub and trees lies at the N.E. end and dominates the area. An old tower and flag_staff from the original mansion, incorporated in a new house, crowns the hill. At the foot of the slope lie the Brickworks' clay pits. Those still in use have red clay sides. Water collects in the old ones and scrub covers their sides. On the plain there are many coverts, small woods mostly deciduous planted for protection. The fields mostly grass are small with trimmed hedges mainly hawthorn, elder and recovering elms. Old pollarded willows line some of the ditches. Pollarding is also known as shrouding locally. A railway embankment crossing the area is very obvious.
